intro: Koellia nuda, commonly known as the naked koellia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its aromatic leaves. Koellia nuda is often found in open woodlands and scrublands, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
